question: In which of the following states the influence of the ” Ahrar movement (1931)” was mostly confined to ?
explanation: Arhar (Majlis-e Ahrar-e Islam) was a religious Muslim political party in the British India. It was established on 29 December 1929 at Lahore. The group was constituted with the cynical Indian muslims who took part in the Khilafat Movement. The party was mainly based in Punjab.
